channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped at bus stop, 7th September
item.description:
Rubbish dumped at bus stop blocking the pavement o/s Sams barbers 106 lower road Belvedere DA176DZ making it impassable. Perpetrators need to be held accountable and prosecuted as necessary. Urgent attention required as very busy area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Name Plate, 7th September
item.description:
On Highland Road at the junction with Albion Road, Bexleyheath: The road name plate for Highland Road is illegible to drivers and pedestrians as seen in the attached picture. I reported this issue on here over two years ago and you haven’t replaced it. Please could you replace the road name plate so that it’s clear for the public to read.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 7th September
item.description:
On Albion Road at the junction with Albion Road Multi-Storey Public Car Park (old Civic Centre car park), Bexleyheath: Please could you remove two dumped shopping trolley’s from the grass verge as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Sign, 7th September
item.description:
Outside 41 Highland Road, Bexleyheath, DA6 7LY: A triangular Roundabout approach warning sign has been struck by a high-sided vehicle meaning it’s no longer visible to drivers warning them of a roundabout ahead at the junction. Please could the traffic sign attached to a street light column be realigned so that it’s facing the correct way to drivers - picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Item, 7th September
item.description:
On Oakhouse Road, Bexleyheath - opposite the car park for Grace Baptist Church: Please could you remove a dumped black sack of rubbish from the pavement as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakhouse Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and debris, 7th September
item.description:
Rubbish and debris and weeds have been left on the roundabout at the junction of Long Lane and Pickford Lane following recent road works at this site. Please have it cleared up asap . This has been requested previously.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large household waste (mattress, sofa, dressing table, and drawer) has been dumped in the bin storage area on Mayford Close., 7th September
item.description:
Large household waste (mattress, sofa, dressing table, etc.) has been dumped in the bin storage area on Mayford Close. The items have been there for approximately five days. The bin area is completely full, and all the rubbish bins are overflowing. Some of the waste from their flat, including part of a large sofa, has even been placed inside the bins, causing further blockage. The neighbour did not inform anyone or arrange for collection. CCTV cameras from our property have captured the incident, and both video footage and photos are available as evidence

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayford Close, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked on Whitehaven Street being extremely loud at night, 7th September
item.description:
This car was parked on Whitehaven street, some were sitting in the car, some were outside smoking weed and talking loudly with the engine running loudly. It’s happened before, not sure if it’s the same car, however this is not fair to residents who live on this street, who have to put up with this on a weekly basis. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitehaven Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking in front garden without a dropped curb, 6th September
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 6th September
item.description:
Vans are driving in to how flats late at night and leaving all these things so now not only his it a fire hazard it is harder to get to the chute to put how rubbish in the bins I did report it last week but since then more has been added

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linsey Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Flags on Lamposts, 6th September
item.description:
Flags on the lamposts are a distraction while driving, impact the lamposts proper use and have been installed without any proper health and safety tests. These are also being used by the far right to intimidate and call on others to build racial hatred.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downbank Avenue, Barnehurst, London
